text: and , released in Japan as Pokémon Red and , are two role-playing games. They were made by Game Freak and published by Nintendo, and are the first two video games in the Pokémon series. They were first released for the Game Boy in Japan in 1996. They were later released to the rest of the world in 1998 (North America) and 1999 (Europe and Australia). Pokémon Yellow, a special version, was released one year later in each region. These three games (Pokémon Red, Blue, and Yellow) and Pokémon Stadium make up the first generation of Pokémon video game series. Pokémon Red and Blue have later been remade for the Game Boy Advance as Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen, released in 2004. == Setting and plot == The games are set in the fantasy world of Kanto and follow the adventure of the main character, Red, in his quest to defeat all the 8 Gym Leaders and become the Champion. Both games have almost the same plot, but the player must trade among the two in order to complete the games' Pokédex. The Kanto Saga of the Pokémon anime is based on the games' plots. == Gameplay == Pokémon Red and Blue are turn-based role-playing games. == Reception == Pokémon Red and Blue got good reviews, and their releases started the beginning of what would become a multibillion-dollar company, both selling millions of copies around the world. == References == Category:1996 video games Category:Japanese role-playing video games Category:Game Freak games Category:Game Boy games Category:Game Boy Advance games Category:Multiplayer and single-player video games Category:Pokémon RPGs Category:Video games developed in Japan Category:Virtual pet video games
